description: {"blocks":[{"key":"86k38","text":"The MELD Project is an international collaboration aiming to create open-access, robust and generalisable tools for FCD detection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2aqs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"an90j","text":"This MRI data protocol details ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86gae","text":"1) The MRI data required / desirable for patients and controls in the MELD focal epilepsies project","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"at4v","text":"2) How to convert the MRI data from dicom to nifti","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asp95","text":"3) How to ensure all identifiable data is stripped from the header","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e71fv","text":"4) How to deface the data","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61vss","text":"5) How to convert the data into BIDS format","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80mqa","text":"6) How to send the anonymised data to the study coordinators","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99ia3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71iku","text":"Please refer to protocol 1 for inclusion / exclusion criteria and retrieval of necessary anonymised demographic and clinical information.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lrha","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64h1l","text":"PLEASE NOTE: To take part in the MELD Project each site will be required to 1) sign our memorandum of understanding and 2) provide a letter from the head of department or local R\u0026D office confirming that they have obtained appropriate ethical approval to share the anonymised data with UCL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

The lesion masks will need to be converted to Nifti format. Please save the lesion mask as lesion.nii.gz or lesion.nii in the lesion_mask folder. If the lesion mask was created based on a 1.5T scan, please save in the 1.5T folder. If the lesion mask was created based on a 3T scan, please save in the 3T folder etc.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":367}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88urj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f7lon","text":"How to create a lesion mask:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asieh","text":"The lesion mask should be done on the 3D T1-weighted scan but other scans e.g.  FLAIR and the post-operative T1-weighted can be used to assist in defining the lesion. We provide the FLAIR coregistered (FLAIR_coreg.nii) which can be used to help delineate the lesion.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gm2t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7h4ha","text":"You may need assistance from a neuroradiologist at your centre for the subtle lesions. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eop0b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5hmt","text":"If you have multiple T1-weighted scans at different field strengths - please create the lesion mask based on the T1-weighted scan you can visualise the lesion best on.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"996df","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpc95","text":"If the patient has hippocampal sclerosis OR is MRI negative there is no need to create a lesion mask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2r402","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2j8e7","text":"If the patient is MRI-negative but with histological confirmation, the post-operative scan and other corroborative evidence such as EEG, PET, sEEG etc. can be used to help define where the lesion was on the preoperative scan in order to create the lesion mask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4t0aq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a03qt","text":"If it is NOT possible to create a lesion mask. Please still include this patient in the study. In the RedCap Participant information survey under the question \"Have you provided a lesion mask for this patient?\" Click No","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbq38","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"283p0","text":"If you have any questions or run into problems, please feel free to contact the MELD project: (meld.study@gmail.com).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":95,"length":20}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"15BDAB07170011EC8B1A0A58A9FEAC02","url":"mailto:meld.study@gmail.com"}}}}
